Bad news, guys... turns out the computer I was using won't upload correctly, 
so my files won't work properly. As soon as I can get on a comp with a 
better browser (i.e. not IE) I'll fix that all up properly.

Strategy? Well, I must confess that my most effective team consists of one 
archmage. Alone. His chain lightning is THE most impressive effect in the 
game. I've been able to kill everyone in a level with one blast. Of course, 
there are serious drawbacks to using one character with a bad hand-to-hand. 
Against an enemy with a comparable level, it takes forever to do serious 
damage, so it's usually best to 'port away and create a flock of elementals 
to do your dirty work. You can also summon the image of a druid and use it 
to create real faerie to freeze the opponent. I've been experimenting with a 
team of two clerics, a mage, and an archmage, but it seems to take too long 
to advance them to massive-kill levels. It's just too hard to use teams, 
unless you go in with overwhelming force or struggle to keep everyone 
together with yells. If there were going to be further versions of the game, 
I would suggest that team play be improved...

DPH, what do you mean an RP? A Gladiator fan-fic? That would be cool, I 
guess... I incorporated a running storyline into my scenarios, but that's 
not really the same. (It turned out much better than Tryxian Chronicles...) 
Everyone seems to love Torvald and Neldwyn; why don't we see who can write 
the best Torvald story? Or maybe a Torvald theme song?
                 -Tevildo.
